source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stamen filaments with hairs; anthers lacking appendages
Stamen filaments lacking hairs; anthers with appendages
Margins of petals fimbriate; leaves often more than 15 mm wide; robust plants of dryish, rocky areas in east
Petal margins entire or almost so; leaves less than 15 mm wide
Flowers usually single per node (rarely some nodes 2-flowered); perianth distinctly mauve; tubers subsessile
Flowers usually several per node; perianth white, pink or pale mauve; tubers distant from rootstock
Anthers purple; filament hairs generally purple near anthers
Anthers white or green; filament hairs all white
Flowers deflexed at anthesis and (strongly) in fruit; scape usually unbranched; leaves commonly withered at time of flowering
Flowers erect or spreading at anthesis and in fruit; scape usually branched; leaves present at time of flowering
